title: Action plan - How to make your money go further
description: Tips and advice on how to save money on household bills including being a smart shopper and comparing prices online.
body:
Follow this action plan to help you save money around the home and when you’re out and about, making your hard-earned cash go that bit further.

Save money on your gas and electricity bills

Why?

Your energy bills probably take one of the biggest slices out of your budget each month, so it's worth spending a bit of time trying to cut costs.

How?

Find out how to compare prices, switch suppliers and whether or not to fix your energy tariff.

  • Read our guide Save money on your gas and electricity bills

The most effective way to save on your energy bills is to use less energy.

  • Read our guide Save energy, save money

Shop around for a cheaper home phone and broadband deal

Why?

Because it could potentially save you hundreds of pounds over the course of a year.

How?

  • Read our guide Save money on your home phone and broadband to find out your current usage and where to go to compare deals

Check to see if you could save money on your mobile phone

Why?

Because you might be paying for minutes and texts you don't use, or going over your allowance and ending up with an unnecessarily big bill.

How?

Check to see whether your current contract is coming to an end. If it is, the key thing is to compare deals against your actual usage.

  • Find out how in our guide Save money on your mobile phone

Become a smarter shopper

Why?

Comparing prices and shopping online could save you hundreds of pounds every year on everything from groceries to clothes and electrical goods.

How?

  • Read our guide Smarter shopping - tips and tricks to save money, for more about using comparison sites, vouchers and earning cashback

Check whether you can make savings on your travel costs

Why?

Whether you travel by car or public transport, there are things you can do to save money.

How?

  • Read our guide Cut down on car and travel costs for everything from where to find the cheapest petrol prices to using railcards and season tickets
